texts.AbpShortDescription: ABP Framework is a complete infrastructure to create modern web applications by following the best practices and conventions of software development.
texts.DomainDrivenDesignExplanation: Designed and developed based on DDD patterns and principles. Provides a layered model for your application.
texts.AuthorizationExplanation: Advanced authorization with user, role and fine-grained permission system. Built on Microsoft Identity library.
texts.MultiTenancyExplanationShort: SaaS applications made easy! Integrated multi-tenancy from database to UI.
texts.CrossCuttingConcernsExplanationShort: Complete infrastructure for authorization, validation, exception handling, caching, audit logging, transaction management and more.
texts.BuiltInBundlingMinificationExplanation: No need to use external tools for bundling & minification. ABP offers a simpler, dynamic, powerful, modular and built-in way!
texts.VirtualFileSystemExplanation: Embed views, scripts, styles, images... into packages/libraries and reuse them in different applications.
texts.ThemingExplanationShort: Use and customize the bootstrap-based standard UI theme or create your own.
texts.BootstrapTagHelpersDynamicFormsExplanati: Instead of manually writing the repeating details of bootstrap components, use ABP's tag helpers to simplify them and take advantage of the IntelliSense. Quickly build UI forms based on a C# model using the dynamic form tag helper.
texts.HTTPAPIsDynamicProxiesExplanation: Automatically expose application services as REST style HTTP APIs, and consume them with dynamic JavaScript and C# proxies.
texts.CompleteArchitectureInfo: Modern architecture to create maintainable software solutions.
texts.DomainDrivenDesignBasedLayeringModelExpl: Helps implement a DDD based layered architecture and build a maintainable code base.
Provides startup templates, abstractions, base classes, services, documentation and guides to help you develop your application based on DDD patterns & principles.
texts.MicroserviceCompatibleModelExplanation: The core framework & pre-built modules are designed with microservice architecture in mind.
texts.MicroserviceCompatibleModelExplanationCo: Provides infrastructure, integrations, samples and documentation to implement microservice solutions easier, while it doesn’t bring additional complexity if you want a monolithic application.
texts.ModularInfo: ABP provides a module system that allows you to develop reusable application modules, tie into application lifecycle events, and express dependencies between core parts of your system.
texts.PreBuiltModulesThemesExplanation: Open source and commercial modules & themes are ready to use in your business application.
texts.NuGetNPMPackagesExplanation: Distributed as NuGet & NPM packages. Easy to install and upgrade.
texts.ExtensibleReplaceableExplanation: All services & modules are designed with extensibility in mind. You can replace services, pages, styles and components.
texts.CrossCuttingConcernsExplanation2: Keep your codebase smaller so you can maintain focus on the code that’s specific to your business.
texts.CrossCuttingConcernsExplanation3: Don’t send time implementing common application requirements on multiple projects.
texts.ConventionOverConfigurationExplanation: ABP implements common application conventions by default with minimal or zero configuration.
texts.ConventionOverConfigurationExplanationLi: Auto registers known services to dependency injection.
Exposes application services as HTTP APIs by naming conventions.
Creates dynamic HTTP client proxies for C# and JavaScript.
Provides default repositories for your entities.
Manages Unit of Work per web request or application service method.
Publishes create, update & delete events for your entities.
texts.BaseClassesExplanation: Pre-built base classes for common application patterns.
texts.DeveloperFocusedExplanationCont: It aims to simplify your daily software development while not restricting you from writing low level code.
texts.CLI_CommandLineInterfaceExplanation: Includes a CLI to help you automate the creation of new projects and the addition of new modules.
texts.StartupTemplatesExplanation: ABP’s application startup template provides a fully configured solution to jump start your development.
texts.BasedOnFamiliarToolsExplanation: Built on and integrated with popular tools you already know. Low learning curve, easy adaptation, comfortable development.
texts.ORMIndependentExplanation: The core framework is ORM/database independent and can work with any data source. Entity Framework Core and MongoDB providers are already available.
texts.BackgroundJobsExplanation: Define simple classes to execute jobs in the background as queued. Use the built-in job manager or integrate your own. Hangfire & RabbitMQ integrations are already available.
texts.DistributedEventBusWithRabbitMQIntegrati: Distributed Event Bus with RabbitMQ Integration
texts.ObjectToObjectMappingExplanation: Object to object mapping abstraction with AutoMapper integration.
texts.EmailSMSAbstractionsWithTemplatingSuppor: Email & SMS Abstractions with Templating Support
texts.ABPCLIExplanation: ABP CLI (Command Line Interface) is a command line tool to automate some common operations for ABP based solutions.
texts.ModularityExplanation: ABP provides a complete infrastructure to build your own application modules that may have entities, services, database integration, APIs, UI components and so on..
texts.MultiTenancyExplanation: ABP framework doesn't only support developing multi-tenant applications, but also makes your code mostly unaware of the multi-tenancy.
texts.MultiTenancyExplanation2: Can automatically determine the current tenant, isolate data of different tenants from each other.
texts.MultiTenancyExplanation3: Supports single database, database per tenant and hybrid approaches.
texts.MultiTenancyExplanation4: You focus on your business code and let the framework handle multi-tenancy on behalf of you.
texts.BootstrapTagHelpersExplanation: Instead of manually writing the repeating details of bootstrap components, use ABP's tag helpers to simplify it and take advantage of the IntelliSense. You can definitely use Bootstrap whenever you need it.
texts.DynamicFormsExplanation: Dynamic form & input tag helpers can create the complete form from a C# class as the model.
texts.AuthenticationAuthorizationExplanation: Rich authentication & authorization options integrated to ASP.NET Core Identity & IdentityServer4. Provides an extensible & detailed permission system.
texts.CrossCuttingConcernsExplanation: Don't repeat yourself to implement all this common stuff again & again. Focus on your business code and let ABP automate them by conventions.
texts.BundlingMinificationExplanation: ABP offers a simple, dynamic, powerful, modular and built-in bundling & minification system.
texts.VirtualFileSystemnExplanation: The Virtual File System makes it possible to manage files that do not physically exist on the file system (disk). It's mainly used to embed the (js, css, image, cshtml...) files into assemblies and use them like physical files on runtime.
texts.ThemingExplanation: Theming system allows developing your application & modules theme independent by defining a set of common base libraries and layouts, based on the latest Bootstrap framework.
texts.DomainDrivenDesignInfrastructureExplanat: A complete infrastructure to build layered applications based on the Domain Driven Design patterns & principles;
texts.AutoRESTAPIsExplanation: ABP can automagically configure your application services as API Controllers by convention.
texts.DynamicClientProxiesExplanation: Easily consume your APIs from JavaScript and C# clients.
texts.DistributedEventBusWithRabbitMQIntegrati: Easily publish & consume distributed events using built-in Distributed Event Bus with RabbitMQ integration available.
texts.TestInfrastructureExplanation: The framework has been developed with unit & integration testing in mind. Provides you base classes to make it easier. Startup templates come pre-configured for testing.
texts.AuditLoggingEntityHistoriesExplanation: Built-in audit logging for business-critical applications. Request, service, method level audit logging and entity histories with property-level details.
texts.EmailSMSAbstractionsWithTemplatingSuppor: IEmailSender and ISmsSender abstractions decouples your application logic from the infrastructure. Advanced email template system allows to create & localize email templates and easily use whenever needed.
texts.LocalizationExplanation: Localization system allows creating resources in plain JSON files and uses them to localize your UI. It supports advanced scenarios like inheritance, extensions and JavaScript integration while it is fully compatible with AspNet Core's localization system.
texts.SettingManagementExplanation: Define settings for your application and get the values on runtime based on the current configuration, tenant and user.
texts.ExtensionMethodsHelpersExplanation: Don't repeat yourself even for trivial code parts. Extensions & helpers for standard types make your code much cleaner and easy to write.
texts.AspectOrientedProgrammingExplanation: Provides a comfortable infrastructure to create dynamic proxies and implement Aspect Oriented Programming. Intercept any class and execute your code before & after every method execution.
texts.DependencyInjectionByConventionsExplanat: No need to register your classes to dependency injection manually. Automatically registers common service types by convention. For other type of services, you can use interfaces and attributes to make it easier and in-place.
texts.DataFilteringExplanation: Define and use data filters that are automatically applied when you query entities from the database. Soft Delete & MultiTenant filters are provided out of the box when you implement simple interfaces.
texts.SeeTheDocumentForMoreInformation: Check out the {0} document for more information
texts.IndexPageHeroSection:
open sourceWeb Application
Framework for asp.net core
texts.MeeTTheABPCommunityInfo: Our mission is to create an environment where developers can help each other with posts, tutorials, case studies, etc. and meet like-minded people.
texts.JoinTheABPCommunityInfo: Get involved with a vibrant community and become a contributor to the ABP Framework!
texts.DynamicClientProxyDocument: Check out the dynamic client proxy documentations for JavaScript & C#.
texts.EmailSMSAbstractionsDocument: Check out the emailing and SMS sending documents for more information.
texts.CreateProjectWizard: This wizard creates a new project from the startup template which is properly configured to jump start your project.
texts.TieredOption: Creates a tiered solution where Web and Http API layers are physically separated. If not checked, creates a layered solution which is less complex and suitable for most scenarios.
texts.SeparateIdentityServerOption: Separates the server side into two applications: The first one is for the identity server and the second one is for your server side HTTP API.
texts.InstallABPCLIInfo: ABP CLI is the fastest way to start a new solution with the ABP framework. Install the ABP CLI using a command line window:
texts.DifferentLevelOfNamespaces: You can use different levels of namespaces; e.g. BookStore, Acme.BookStore or Acme.Retail.BookStore.
texts.ABPCLIExamplesInfo: The new command creates a layered MVC application with Entity Framework Core as the database provider. However, it has additional options.
texts.SeeCliDocumentForMoreInformation: Check out the ABP CLI document for more options or select the "Direct Download" tab above.
texts.LocalFrameworkRef: Keep the local project reference for the framework packages.
texts.BlobStoringExplanation: BLOB Storing system provides an abstraction to work with BLOBs. ABP provides some pre-built storage provider integrations (Azure, AWS, File System, Database, etc.) that you can easily use in your applications.
texts.TextTemplatingExplanation: Text templating is used to dynamically render contents based on a template and a model (a data object). For example, you can use it to create dynamic email contents with a pre-built template.
texts.MultipleUIOptionsExplanation: The core framework is designed as UI independent and can work with any type of UI system, while there are multiple pre-built and integrated options provided out of the box.
texts.MultipleDBOptionsExplanation: The framework can work with any data source, while the following providers are officially developed and supported:
texts.MVCGulpCommandExplanation: If you are using MVC (Razor Pages) UI, then run the "gulp" command after the package installation.
texts.ABPCLIModuleDependency: Abp Cli automatically adds module dependency.
texts.ProjectCreationSuccessMessage: Your project has been successfully created
texts.GettingStartedMessage: Check out the getting started document to learn how to configure and run your solution.
texts.WebAppDevTutorialMessage: Check out the web application development tutorial document for a step by step development sample.
texts.CommunityPostMessage: Check out the ABP Community Platform to read useful posts for ABP Framework.
texts.StartupTemplateDocumentationMessage: Check out the application startup template document to learn the architecture and the structure of your solution.
texts.ClientSideDevelopmentDocumentationMessag: Check out the {0} document  to learn the key points for the user interface (client side) development.
texts.DatabaseProviderDocumentationMessage: Check out the {0} document   to learn the key points for the database layer development.
texts.ABPCommercialExplanationMessage: ABP Commercial provides premium modules, themes, tooling and support for the ABP Framework.
texts.DDDBookExplanation: A practical guide for implementing the Domain Driven Design with the ABP Framework.
texts.DDDBookPracticalGuide: This is a practical guide for implementing the Domain Driven Design (DDD). While the implementation details are based on the ABP Framework infrastructure, the basic concepts, principles and models can be applied to any solution, even if it is not a .NET solution.
texts.IntroductionToImplementingDDD: Introduction to Implementing the Domain Driven Design
texts.WhatIsDDD: What is the Domain Driven Design?

texts.SubscribeToNewsletter: Subscribe to the newsletter to get information about happenings in the ABP.IO Platform, such as new releases, posts, offers, and more.

texts.AuditLoggingExplanation: Automatically trace all the operations and data changes in your system.
texts.AbpNewCommandExplanation: Creates new solutions using the ABP startup templates.
texts.AbpAddModuleCommandExplanation: Installs pre-built application modules to your solution
texts.AbpUpdateCommandExplanation: Automatically updates all the ABP related NuGet and NPM packages in your solution.
texts.ExploreDocumentationAndGuides: Explore the comprehensive documentation and guides.
texts.EnterYouEmailToGetNews: Enter your email to get the latest news about the ABP Framework
texts.FrameworkNewsletterConfirmationMessage: I agree to the Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy.
texts.GetYourFreeEBook: Get Your Free DDD E-book
texts.UIThemingExplanation: Create reusable UI themes and layouts or use one of the pre-built UI themes.
texts.DataFilteringExplanation2: Automatically filter on querying from the database to easily implement patterns like soft-delete and multi-tenancy.
